Hi all, got a question. I have a vacancy database (external) and I want to be able to show these vacancies in marketing emails based on the interest of our contacts. So if a contact is interested in a certain branch, I want to show those vacancies. My first thought was to setup a sync between this database (through XML) and use the API to import these vacancies in HubDB. But I just read the docs and they say it is not possible to filter the HubDB based on contact properties. So if a contact has shown interest for a certain branch I can not filter the vacancies based on that branch when I use HubDB.
Does anyone know a solution where I can filter HubDB based on contact properties or use a different method to get those vacancies in the marketing emails?
Thanks!
<@U018SKF3M9U> <@U9KA594Q3> Is there a way to achieve this? I am not familiar with the use of hubdb functions in emails..
You’re correct that thats not supported at the moment. You could create lists based on branches and then create an email for each branch. That might not be ideal with many branches though
during inbound personalized emails were announced, did not see the functionality yet but expect you can get close to what you are trying to accomplish
No but I was asking to see if someone already did this
Thanks for the input! Is there a decent way to show data from an external source in marketing emails? I might create a little app that can function as an API.
